thread.title: Nashville is coming to Manchester Arena - how to get tickets
thread.title_full: Nashville is coming to Manchester Arena - how to get tickets

author: Sarah Walters
title: Nashville is coming to Manchester Arena - how to get tickets
text:
Get What's On   
The stars of American country music TV drama Nashville are heading back to the UK - and this time they're booked in to play arenas. 
Cast favourites Clare Bowen, Chris Carmack, Charles Esten, and Jonathan Jackson are all lined up to return to our shores following a successful debut tour which brought some of them to the Bridgewater Hall almost exactly a year earlier. 
The tour will stop at Manchester Arena on June 17, 2017 as the finale of a short UK tour that starts in Birmingham on June 9 and includes dates in London, Brighton, Nottingham and Glasgow. 
The musical TV drama has been a sensation, broadcasting in 70 countries and now running on American TV with a live chat show after each episode. Read More One Tribe Festival announces its debut line up - how to get tickets 
The show has been nominated for Golden Globe Awards, Emmys, and several People's Choice gongs, and produced 16 soundtrack albums. It was first shown in the UK on TV channel More4 in 2013, and is now broadcasting its fifth season in the States. 
The artists lined up for the live tour play regular characters Scarlett O’Connor (Bowen), Will Lexington (Carmack), Deacon Claybourne (Esten), and Avery Barkley (Jackson). (Photo: Rick Diamond/Getty Images) 
Says Steve Buchanan, president of Opry Entertainment, of the live tour: “The Nashville cast is comprised of individuals who excel as actors, musicians, songwriters, and performers. Since the first night the series went on the air, the cast members have also become incredible ambassadors for our Tennessee home.” 
Tickets go on sale at 10am on Friday, February 17 via Ticketmaster and the Manchester Arena website. Like us on Facebook
